briefdescription.para: Appends item into the control.

parameterdescription.para: String to add.

simplesect.para: The return value is the index of the newly inserted item. Note that this may be different from the last one if the control is sorted (e.g. has wxLB_SORT or wxCB_SORT style).

briefdescription.para: Appends item into the control.

parameterdescription.para: String to add.
Pointer to client data to associate with the new item.

simplesect.para: The return value is the index of the newly inserted item. Note that this may be different from the last one if the control is sorted (e.g. has wxLB_SORT or wxCB_SORT style).

briefdescription.para: Appends item into the control.

parameterdescription.para: String to add.
Pointer to client data to associate with the new item.

simplesect.para: The return value is the index of the newly inserted item. Note that this may be different from the last one if the control is sorted (e.g. has wxLB_SORT or wxCB_SORT style).

briefdescription.para: Appends several items at once into the control.

detaileddescription.para: Notice that calling this method is usually much faster than appending them one by one if you need to add a lot of items.

parameterdescription.para: Array of strings to insert.

briefdescription.para: Appends several items at once into the control.

detaileddescription.para: Notice that calling this method is usually much faster than appending them one by one if you need to add a lot of items.

parameterdescription.para: Array of strings to insert.
Array of client data pointers of the same size as items to associate with the new items.

parameterdescription.para: Number of items in the items array.
Array of strings of size n.

detaileddescription.para: Notice that calling this method is usually much faster than appending them one by one if you need to add a lot of items.

briefdescription.para: Appends several items at once into the control.

detaileddescription.para: Notice that calling this method is usually much faster than appending them one by one if you need to add a lot of items.

parameterdescription.para: Number of items in the items array.
Array of strings of size n.
Array of client data pointers of size n to associate with the new items.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the client data associated with the given item (if any).

detaileddescription.para: It is an error to call this function for a control which doesn't have untyped client data at all although it is OK to call it even if the given item doesn't have any client data associated with it (but other items do).

parameterdescription.para: The zero-based position of the item.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the client data, or NULL if not present.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the client data associated with the given item (if any).

detaileddescription.para: It is an error to call this function for a control which doesn't have typed client data at all although it is OK to call it even if the given item doesn't have any client data associated with it (but other items do).
Notice that the returned pointer is still owned by the control and will be deleted by it, use DetachClientObject() if you want to remove the pointer from the control.

parameterdescription.para: The zero-based position of the item.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the client data, or NULL if not present.

briefdescription.para: Associates the given untyped client data pointer with the given item.

detaileddescription.para: Note that it is an error to call this function if any typed client data pointers had been associated with the control items before.

parameterdescription.para: The zero-based item index.
The client data to associate with the item.

briefdescription.para: Associates the given typed client data pointer with the given item: the data object will be deleted when the item is deleted (either explicitly by using Delete() or implicitly when the control itself is destroyed).

detaileddescription.para: Note that it is an error to call this function if any untyped client data pointers had been associated with the control items before.

parameterdescription.para: The zero-based item index.
The client data to associate with the item.

briefdescription.para: Inserts item into the control.

parameterdescription.para: String to add.
Position to insert item before, zero based.

simplesect.para: The return value is the index of the newly inserted item. If the insertion failed for some reason, -1 is returned.

memberdef.name: Insert

briefdescription.para: Inserts several items at once into the control.

detaileddescription.para: Notice that calling this method is usually much faster than inserting them one by one if you need to insert a lot of items.

parameterdescription.para: Number of items in the items array.
Array of strings of size n.
Position to insert the new items before, zero based.
Array of client data pointers of size n to associate with the new items.

simplesect.para: The return value is the index of the last inserted item. If the insertion failed for some reason, -1 is returned.

briefdescription.para: Replaces the current control contents with the given items.

detaileddescription.para: Notice that calling this method is usually much faster than appending them one by one if you need to add a lot of items.

parameterdescription.para: Array of strings to insert.

briefdescription.para: Replaces the current control contents with the given items.

detaileddescription.para: Notice that calling this method is usually much faster than appending them one by one if you need to add a lot of items.

parameterdescription.para: Array of strings to insert.
Array of client data pointers of the same size as items to associate with the new items.

briefdescription.para: Removes all items from the control.

detaileddescription.para: Clear() also deletes the client data of the existing items if it is owned by the control.

briefdescription.para: Deletes an item from the control.

detaileddescription.para: The client data associated with the item will be also deleted if it is owned by the control. Note that it is an error (signalled by an assert failure in debug builds) to remove an item with the index negative or greater or equal than the number of items in the control.

parameterdescription.para: The zero-based item index.

briefdescription.para: Returns the client object associated with the given item and transfers its ownership to the caller.

detaileddescription.para: This method, unlike GetClientObject(), expects the caller to delete the returned pointer. It also replaces the internally stored pointer with NULL, i.e. completely detaches the client object pointer from the control.
It's an error to call this method unless HasClientObjectData() returns true.

parameterdescription.para: The zero-based item index.

simplesect.para: The associated client object pointer to be deleted by caller or NULL.

briefdescription.para: Returns true, if either untyped data (void*) or object data (wxClientData*) is associated with the items of the control.
Returns true, if object data is associated with the items of the control.

detaileddescription.para: Object data pointers have the type wxClientData* instead of void* and, importantly, are owned by the control, i.e. will be deleted by it, unlike their untyped counterparts.

briefdescription.para: Returns true, if untyped data (void*) is associated with the items of the control.
This class is an abstract base class for some wxWidgets controls which contain several items such as wxListBox, wxCheckListBox, wxComboBox or wxChoice.

detaileddescription.para: It defines an interface which is implemented by all controls which have string subitems each of which may be selected.
wxItemContainer extends wxItemContainerImmutable interface with methods for adding/removing items.
It defines the methods for accessing the controls items and although each of the derived classes implements them differently, they still all conform to the same interface.

The items in a wxItemContainer have (non-empty) string labels and, optionally, client data associated with them. Client data may be of two different kinds: either simple untyped (void *) pointers which are simply stored by the control but not used in any way by it, or typed pointers (wxClientData*) which are owned by the control meaning that the typed client data (and only it) will be deleted when an item is deleted using Delete() or the entire control is cleared using Clear(), which also happens when it is destroyed.

Finally note that in the same control all items must have client data of the same type (typed or untyped), if any. This type is determined by the first call to Append() (the version with client data pointer) or SetClientData().
Note that this is not a control, it's a mixin interface that classes have to derive from in addition to wxControl or wxWindow. Convenience class wxControlWithItems is provided for this purpose.
Library:wxCore
Category:Controls
